name: places/ChIJufZmihlZwokRk07iJhNh86Y
formattedAddress: 518 E 20th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 518 E 20th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: I have been seeing "Freddie" for the past 5 years as my primary care physician.  Dr. Verzosa is thorough and thoughtful every time I see him whether it's for my yearly check-up or for something spur of the moment that needs medical attention. I like his proactive approach and his encouragement for me to be engaged in my own healthcare and healthy living.  I know he's looking out for me.

text.text: I have been seeing "Freddie" for the past 5 years as my primary care physician.  Dr. Verzosa is thorough and thoughtful every time I see him whether it's for my yearly check-up or for something spur of the moment that needs medical attention. I like his proactive approach and his encouragement for me to be engaged in my own healthcare and healthy living.  I know he's looking out for me.

originalText.text: Dr. Verzosa is a caring and professional doctor. He listens carefully to his patients and responds clearly to their questions. I always leave his office feeling that he has thoroughly taken care of me.

text.text: Dr. Verzosa is a caring and professional doctor. He listens carefully to his patients and responds clearly to their questions. I always leave his office feeling that he has thoroughly taken care of me.

originalText.text:
He's Ok. Not sure about his staff. I was sent several times to out-of-network doctors, "by mistake." I didn't find out until after. One cost me almost $600. And I didn't even need to go, I just didn't want to cancel on the doctor. Since then I started triple-quadruple checking to make sure that they would send me to in-network referrals only. Once I waited in the room for 20 minutes and as the doctor walked in I got a very important brief call from the passport office in Canada, which I had to take. He pressured me to hang up or he'd leave. He couldn't even wait 30 seconds. After he kept me waiting 20 minutes.
The last straw was this: The communication is poor. It takes days for responses to non-emergencies. Upon asking a basic question about the safety of LASIK surgery via the Mt Sanai messaging system, some staff member that I'd never talked to before, intercepted it and responded that I must make an appointment to ask that (very simple) question. I'm not taking a day off work to com in and ask his opinion on LASIK. That's what the messaging system is for. I asked them nicely just to send my communication to my primary care doctor, (whom I was messaging directly,) and they never responded. See ya. A PCP is supposed to be available and direct. Verzosa is not. Too bad because I liked him otherwise.

originalText.text: Dr. Verzosa provides great care each time. He explains, in clear detail, all vaccinations and preventive care measures available to me. Also listens thoroughly to my questions and concerns.

text.text: Dr. Verzosa provides great care each time. He explains, in clear detail, all vaccinations and preventive care measures available to me. Also listens thoroughly to my questions and concerns.

originalText.text: Doctor Verzosa is fantastic. I have had several different primary physicians over the years and he is the most thorough and the most down to earth. I highly recommend Doctor Verzosa.

text.text: Doctor Verzosa is fantastic. I have had several different primary physicians over the years and he is the most thorough and the most down to earth. I highly recommend Doctor Verzosa.
